instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground, also <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
hey guys

<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, very minor liquid damage at <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>, on pin 8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, and the small capacitors around there, replaced everything, except <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> short to ground, Diode mode shows 0.000, 

also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is shorted to ground as well, when i plug in the power cord, CPU Warms up, 

Dead CPU? or do you guys have any ideas? Should i replace <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> First?

also i took out <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>, and Pin 43 is Showing 0.000 at diode mode

Thank you guys in advance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground, also <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Dead CPU. <CHIP>U7310</CHIP> getting liquid means the CPU got a spike of 12 volts and died instantly. RIP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00138</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> Shorted to ground, also <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL>
